src:
V inkubatorju 1500 otrok in mladih
V Pionirskem domu obiskujejo več kot 30 kulturnih in jezikovnih tečajev. Njihove številne produkcije si je lani ogledalo prek 20.000 ljudi.
04 Nov 2019, 14:23 by S. N.



Pionirski dom z domišljenim konceptom izvajanja programov za otroke, mlade in odrasle izgrajuje trajnosten in celovit sistem kulturno-umetniškega in jezikovno-kulturnega izobraževanja. FOTO: Igor Sukur



Z leti je Pionorski dom postal eden največjih centrov kulturno-umetniškega in jezikovno-kulturnega ustvarjanja otrok. FOTO: Igor Sukur



Tudi letošnje šolsko leto bo pestro. FOTO: Igor Sukur



Prve dame Pionirskega doma FOTO: Mediaspeed.net


LJUBLJANA – Šolsko leto 2018/19 so v Pionirskem domu – Centru za kulturo mladih zaključili s presežki, uspešno leto pa je zavod še dodatno utrdilo pri zavedanju o pomenu vzgoje za kulturo in njene odprtosti skozi mednarodno sodelovanje. Pionirski dom s svojim domišljenim konceptom izvajanja programov za otroke, mlade in odrasle, osmimi festivali, izobraževanji za učitelje, mentorje in pedagoge izgrajuje trajnosten in celovit sistem kulturno-umetniškega in jezikovno-kulturnega izobraževanja.V celoletne in krajše programe je letos vpisanih že 1500 otrok in mladih, ki obiskujejo več kot 30 različnih kulturnih in jezikovnih tečajev. Lani je na osmih festivalih aktivno sodelovalo več kot 5000 mladih, številne produkcije pa si je ogledalo več kot 20.000 gledalcev! Direktorica zavoda Viktorija Potočnik pravi, da so s kakovostnim in vsebinskim bogatenjem izvajanja celoletnih in krajših programov na kulturno-umetniškem in jezikovno-kulturnem področju programe povezovali, jih dopolnjevali pri izvajanju


Z leti je Pionorski dom postal eden največjih centrov kulturno-umetniškega in jezikovno-kulturnega ustvarjanja otrok. FOTO: Igor Sukur

festivalov za otroke in mladostnike, počitniških šolah, izobraževanju učiteljev in si ustvarili ugled v mednarodnem prostoru. »Delovali smo kot strokovna organizacija, ki spodbuja ustvarjalnost posameznika, njegovo kritično razmišljanje v odnosu do sebe in okolja.« Kot je poudarila predsednica strokovnega sveta zavoda dr. Mateja Gaber, Pionirski dom – Center za kulturo mladih ni samo fakultativna ustanova. »V zavodu prevladujejo trije pomembni vidiki delovanja: izobraževalni, mnogoterostni in povezovalni. Vsi otroci, ki svoj čas preživijo tukaj, so v izobraževalnem, konstruktivnem okolju.« Petindvajset celoletnih programov na kulturno-umetniškem in več kot 10 na jezikovno-kulturnem področju ponuja možnost, da se v njih najdejo in znajdejo vsi, omogočili so dostopnost različnih programov otrokom iz socialno šibkejših okolij in začeli izvajati likovne delavnice za mlade z downovim sindromom.
V inkubatorju ustvarjalnosti mlade vzgajajo prek kulture in umetnosti.
Ne le doma, zavod se vse bolj utrjuje tudi v evropskem prostoru: spet so nosilci projekta Young Theatre on the Move, Mlado gledališče v gibanju, in partnerji projekta Liberty, Svoboda. Pedagogi zavoda sodelujejo na številnih strokovnih izobraževanjih in konferencah doma in v tujini. Prvega oktobra so začeli projekt Mlado gledališče v gibanju, ki bo potekal do 30. novembra 2021 in ki improvizacijskemu gledališču dodaja element ustvarjalnega giba iz sodobnega plesa, je pojasnila pomočnica direktorice in vodja evropskega projekta Bjanka Kršmanc: »Njegov namen je izobraziti pedagoge, gledališke in druge kulturne ustvarjalce ter posameznike iz različnih institucij, da bodo mladi postali aktivnejši uporabniki kulturnih vsebin.« Projekt med drugim spodbuja k pridobivanju različnih tehnik in znanj skozi gibanje in je prepoznan kot model dobre prakse tudi v tujini.Kot rečeno, zavod organizira osem festivalov, ki imajo ob koncu leta najmanj 20.000 obiskovalcev, pravi vodja oddelka za kulturo Vesna Tripković. »Prek festivalov smo postali partnerji v mednarodnem projektu Liberty, v katerega bo vključenih več kot 750 mladih umetnikov. Z njim želimo prek kulture in umetnosti vzgajati mlado občinstvo ter prispevati k integraciji, predvsem beguncev in socialno deprivilegiranih posameznikov in skupin.« V mednarodnem projektu sodelovanja velikega obsega Liberty bo soustvarjalo 12 partnerskih institucij, potekal bo do 31. januarja 2023.


Tudi letošnje šolsko leto bo pestro. FOTO: Igor Sukur

Tudi tujih jezikov se je mogoče učiti v Pionirskem domu, in to že več kot 60 let, je pojasnila vodja oddelka za tuje jezike in kulture Karmen Fehler Malačič in še, da v zavodu tečajnike pripravljajo tudi na mednarodne izpite angleškega, španskega, nemškega, francoskega, italijanskega in japonskega jezika. »Letos smo dodali še en uspeh, poleg uradnega izpitnega centra za španščino DELE, ki ga izvajamo v sodelovanju z Institutom Cervantes, smo postali uradni izpitni center za mednarodne izpite Cambridge Assessment English.«Prepoznavnost Pionirskega doma – Centra za kulturo mladih in mednarodno priznanje zavodu, ki ga izkazujejo partnerji skozi zaupanje in izpostavljanje zavoda kot model dobre prakse so, po besedah Potočnikove, tudi spodbuda za nadaljnjo strokovno in trajnostno oblikovanje vsebin zavoda. »Poseben izziv za razvoj naših vsebin vidimo tudi v času priprav na kandidaturo Ljubljane za evropsko prestolnico kulture.«


Prve dame Pionirskega doma FOTO: Mediaspeed.net

Poseben izziv za razvoj naših vsebin vidimo tudi v času priprav na kandidaturo Ljubljane za evropsko prestolnico kulture.
text:
In the incubator 1500 children and young people
The Pioneer Home is attended by more than 30 cultural and language courses. Over 20,000 people saw their many productions last year.
04 Nov 2019, 14:23 by S. N.



A pioneering home, with a thoughtful concept of implementing programs for children, young people and adults, builds a sustainable and comprehensive system of cultural-artistic and linguistic-cultural education. PHOTO: Igor Sukur



Over the years, the Pioneer Home has become one of the largest centers of cultural-artistic and linguistic-cultural creation of children. PHOTO: Igor Sukur



This school year will also be colorful. PHOTO: Igor Sukur



First Ladies of the Pioneer Home PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net


LJUBLJANA - The 2018/19 school year was completed with surpluses at the Pioneer Center - Center for Youth Culture, and the successful year was further consolidated by the Institute in its awareness of the importance of cultural education and its openness through international cooperation. Pioneering Home, with its ingenious concept of running programs for children, young people and adults, eight festivals, training for teachers, mentors and pedagogues, builds a sustainable and comprehensive system of cultural, artistic and linguistic-cultural education. and young people who attend more than 30 different cultural and linguistic courses. Last year, more than 5,000 young people actively participated in eight festivals, and many productions were viewed by more than 20,000 spectators! Director of the Institute Viktorija Potočnik says that the quality and content enrichment of the implementation of year-round and shorter programs in the cultural, artistic and linguistic and cultural fields have been linked, complemented in the implementation


Over the years, the Pioneer Home has become one of the largest centers of cultural-artistic and linguistic-cultural creation of children. PHOTO: Igor Sukur

festivals for children and adolescents, holiday schools, teacher training and have a reputation in the international arena. "We acted as a professional organization that promotes the creativity of the individual, his critical thinking in relation to himself and the environment." Mateja Gaber, Pioneer Home - The Youth Culture Center is not just an optional institution. “The institution is dominated by three important aspects of operation: educational, multi-faceted and integrative. All the children who spend their time here are in an educational, constructive environment. ”Twenty-five year-long cultural and artistic programs and more than 10 linguistic and cultural programs offer the opportunity for everyone to find and find themselves, making various programs accessible children from socially disadvantaged backgrounds and started performing art workshops for young people with Down Syndrome.
In the incubator of creativity, young people are educated through culture and the arts.
Not only at home, the institution is also increasingly consolidated in the European space: again, the promoters of the Young Theater on the Move project, the Young Theater on the Move, and partners of the Liberty project, Freedom. The institute's educators participate in numerous professional trainings and conferences at home and abroad. On October 1st, the Young Theater on the Move project was launched, which will run until November 30, 2021, which adds to the improvisational theater an element of creative movement from contemporary dance, explained Assistant Director and European Project Manager Bjanka Krsmanc: "It aims to educate educators, theater and other cultural creators and individuals from different institutions to help young people become more active users of cultural content. ”The project encourages, among other things, the acquisition of different techniques and skills through movement and is recognized as a model of good practice abroad.In other words, the organization organizes eight festivals, which have at least 20,000 visitors at the end of the year, says culture department head Vesna Tripkovic. “Through the festivals, we have become partners in the international Liberty project, which will involve more than 750 young artists. It aims to educate young audiences through culture and the arts and contribute to integration, especially of refugees and socially disadvantaged individuals and groups. ”The Liberty International Large-Scale Collaboration Project will co-create 12 partner institutions and will run through January 31, 2023.


This school year will also be colorful. PHOTO: Igor Sukur

Foreign languages can also be taught at the Pioneer Center for more than 60 years, explained Karmen Fehler Malacic, head of the department for foreign languages and cultures, and that they also prepare students for international exams in English, Spanish, German, French , Italian and Japanese. "This year, we have added another success, in addition to the official DELE Spanish Exam Center, run in collaboration with the Cervantes Institute, we have become the official Cambridge Assessment English exam center." Visibility of the Pioneer Home - Center for Youth Culture and International recognition , shown by partners through trust and exposure of the institution as a model of good practice, according to Potočnik, are also an incentive for further professional and sustainable design of the contents of the institution. "We see a special challenge for the development of our contents as we prepare for Ljubljana's bid for the European Capital of Culture."


First Ladies of the Pioneer Home PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net

We also see a particular challenge in the development of our content in the run-up to Ljubljana's bid for the European Capital of Culture.
